My first run, I did had a dark patch on my ankle, but that was user-error. My second go was flawless.  Tips:  -Exfoliate like crazy before hand. I used a wash rag with a body scrub. Really scrub your elbows, ankles, knees, wrists, and neck. Also, I'd recommend shaving after exfoliating, for the smoothest application. -Fully dry your body, before applying. I literally just stood in front of a fan for a while, to make sure I was completely dry. -I applied a super light layer of lotion to the backs of my hands, the tops of my feet, my knees, and elbows. Fake tanner loves to hang out in those areas, so it helps prevent any extra saturation. - With the application mitt, apply a pump or two, using upward (but slightly arched) motions, to each leg. Since the foam is brown, it's pretty easy to see what you've covered. A full length mirror is pretty handy for this. Again, let it dry completely. It'll still feel a little sticky, in my opinion, but it should be dry. -Apply to torso and back in same fashion. Dry fully. -Then apply to arms. Dry fully. -Wash your hands, because some of the foam may have snuck through. -Now, there will be some residual foam on the mitt. You might not see it, but it's there. Take the mitt, and rub it on your feet, toes, ankles, wrists, backs of your hands, and fingers. I also do my face last (which I've already moisturizer), so my face isn't totally pale. It seems like it's not enough, but it definitely is. -After my body is fully dried, I still stand in front of the fan for even longer, to really make sure. I get dressed with an oversized shirt, and loose short shorts. I sleep for eight hours with the foam on, with a fan pointed at me, so I don't sweat it off. -In the morning, I gently rinse off the fake tan first, and then take my shower as usual. -Your shirt will definitely be stained from the fake tan, but it doesn't rub off of your skin or leave any weird marks. it's basically just the excess coming off. -After all of that, you'll have a beautiful tan! Be sure to exfoliate after three days or so, to prevent any weird splotches as it fades. Dark spots will appear, when dead skin isn't sloughing off at the same rate as other areas. So, exfoliating later is important too!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I honestly LOVE this foaming mousse tanner. Make sure you purchase the MIT with it, very necessary. Gives you the tanned look without the sun! Long lasting. Best self tanner I have tried, worth the money! Wait before it dries before getting dressed.

I've only ever used gradual lotion self tanners but now I'm only going to use this! It's so easy to apply and doesn't have a chemical odour. It goes on so evenly with the mitt, I had no streaks. Definitely my new go-to! This may even replace my spray tanning routine. I also watched the st tropez tutorial beforehand and it gave me some great tips!!!
Pretty natural colored tanner but holy STAINS. Just looked at the shirt I wore to bed and it's completely covered in this stuff. My sheets also have an outline of my body.

reviews.review_title: Great for a new self tanner
reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly this is the first real self tanner that I've picked up other than drug store gradual lotions. I have to say as a first timer St. Tropez was very easy to use and I found it to be streak free and a beautiful colour! I didn't find the scent to be strong at all, I would say that I didn't even notice anything and as a very fair skinned lady it didn't look too dark or orange at all! If you're a first timer and unsure as what product to use I would definitely recommend St. Tropez!

I got this mousse upon the suggestion of every tanner I know. They kept telling me what I needed (you have to get the mitt) and explained how much of an impact this made. I am VERY satisfied with the outcome! I will be repurchasing this.   I had to let it dry (it's quick) and within 10 minutes I could lay down with little to no transfer on my sheets. The next day, nothing came off on my clothes! I'm in heaven!

I have very fair/pale skin tone with some red undertones and my skin type is dry.  I have never been able to get a tan naturally or artificially. After reading some positive reviews on here I decided to give St. Tropez a go and I'm 10/10 impressed. The application process was easy, no streaks, no smell, & not orange. As first time user I am really happy it worked so well and excited I finally have a tan!
Worked great, left me with a nice tan for weeks with no patchiness

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've gotten every spray tan you can imagine and used every self tanner and let me say- yikes. Spent most of my adult life being orange. But not St. Tropez. Omg. It smells better than most self tanners, and it is buildable and natural color. I have never found it to be streaky or patchy, just make sure you use the applicator glove in GOOD LIGHTING and blend blend blend the product and you will look AMAZING.

I have vey pale skin with red hair. This is the first self tanner I've ever tried that didn't turn my skin an outrageous orange color. The color is natural and tan. Definitely buy the applicator mitt! Application takes a little getting used to but it is pretty easy to use. Lasts through a few showers without retouching. Will purchase again!
It leaves perfect tan even after reusing after several months! But I just can't stand this strong smell :( since I finished a bottle somehow I need to find another product.

As per recommendation from a friend, I went into Sephora looking for this product. I was happy to find out that I could get this product with my beauty insider points. I then got 2 of the bottles excited to try it as soon as I got home. I'm naturally very pale, and I applied this without the mitt just my bare hands. I got very beautiful results and I'm in love with this product. My hands are stained, but it's a small price to pay for a beautiful, glowing tan.

reviews.review_title: Best I've tried for fair skin
reviews.review_text: Make sure to shave and exfoliate first.  Dry completely.  Apply a good cream to knees, elbows, toes, bottom of feet, and inside hands, knuckles & fingertips.  Afterwards, put a couple pumps on mitt, start on lower leg and work up, add a couple pumps as you go.  Use excess on mitt to do tips of feet.  Do this all over.  I do arms and hands last, since I don't like my inner elbows to get sweaty and streak it.  Once done, I stand in front of a fan for about 5-10 mins.  Then I put baby powder on all over and go to bed.  In the morning I shower and this tan looks perfect!  In the summer to keep it going I do this about every 3 days.  A little bit of a process, but looks so good on my overly pale skin.  Good luck!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: As someone with super pale skin, I have tried every type of self tanner, spray tan etc. This is the first product that I can apply myself (except my back,) and it looks streak free and natural in color. I love this, highly recommend getting the mitt to apply. It's half the battle.

I have cool ivory toned skin and this works pretty well for me. Sometimes I get a little orange on my forearms and hands. You must use an exfoliating glove beforehand. A loofa will not do enough. Each application I get a slightly different result. Maybe it's how hydrated my skin is before exfoliating. I'm not sure. Either way this will continue to be part of my weekly routine and I've received many compliments on my tan.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have to write a review for this mousse because I have tried SO many tanners - probably all of them out there - and this is by far the best! I have very fair skin, so most self-tanners end up being streaky on me.The mousse is very velvety, goes on smooth with the mitt or latex gloves, and it is easy to see where you've applied it.   My routine is to moisturize moisturize moisturize every day before I apply my tanner. Exfoliate really well on the day you are applying. You will have a flawless tan! For me, my tan lasts a good 3-5ish days if I moisturize. It will fade if you swim in chlorine or salt water and it will get a little patchy when the tan wears off (but you will get that with any fake tan)  I'm not kidding when I say me and my friends swear by the St. Tropez products - works for my fair skin and my friend's medium/tan skin too, so definitely versatile.   Anyways, I love it!  p.s. I've also tried the tanning oil and I like that too but that's another review for another day LOL

I began my self tan journey in 2013 with the Fake Bake, Neutrogena, Clairins, and Clinique products. While they served me justice, it wasn't until an Amazon whim purchase of St Tropez that changed my world. I haven't used anything but St Tropez since late 2013!  You should know that I have very pale skin, dozens of moles and freckles, and many red acne scars on my face. St Tropez evened my body skin tone and complexion to a gorgeous, natural, luxurious, radiant glow. St Tropez made me feel incredibly sexy and attractive as it blended my all-over-body depigmentation into one blended, bronzed, and flawless complexion. St Tropez is part of my biweekly routine - an exfoliative shower and paint application that will last me at least 4 days with daily showers and 7-8 days if I shower every other day.  St Tropez doesn't leave me smelling like the typical burnt skin fake tan signature. It leaves me and my sheets smelling like coconut sunscreen. It will dirty white sheets and clothes, but it's nothing that a regular cold wash can't perfectly wash out. If I apply the self tanner without exfoliating the previous tanner off, it will come out orange and patchy. But as the basis of every self tanner goes, it will only be as good as the canvas you provide!  St Tropez will remain my tried and true, ultimate beauty staple. While my hair and makeup favourites are ever evolving, St Tropez has stayed the same for 4 years straight.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This was my first time using self tanner and I could not be more happy with the results. I was worried that despite the great reviews, this product would be hard to use for a beginner but that was not the case at all. This product was easy to apply and looked great. I have received so many compliments on my natural looking tan. As long as you moisturize, it lasts pretty long as well. I've been re-applying every week and a half or so. WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

This bronzing mousse is hands down the best product for a fake-natural tan! It is so build-able and so easy.. with spray tans, people have always been able to tell it's a spray tan, but with this --- no one even notices the subtle build up of color over time!! It's so gorgeous, I swear by it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am a red head and extremely fair, and this is by far my favorite self tanner I have tried.  When used with the mitt, you get a very natural looking tan/glow that's streak-free (but be sure to moisturize and exfoliate prior).  Application is so easy because you can see where you've put it on and it won't hurt if you overlap on some areas to make sure it's all rubbed in evenly, but it dries quickly, so work fast.  There's a bit of a smell when using this, but I believe it's tolerable and better than the scent of most self-tanners.  If you are fair-skinned, give this a shot.  I was nervous to try this at first because I thought it might be too dramatic, but it's very natural. It doesn't make me look orange or fake in anyway.  I could see how medium-darker complexions wouldn't be that impressed by this product ( if that's you check out their dark mousse) because it is so natural.  It's pricey, but you get a lot of uses out of this product.  As a pale girl living in the south and close to the coast, let me say this self-tanner has become a staple in my beauty routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am always telling everyone about this product! first heard about it from my daughters friend who is a newscaster in town, she uses is to look fabulous on camera. So I first tried it 4 years ago, Fabulous instant color that stays with you. We were just in Hawaii (true story) and I picked some up at the Sepohora there. These girls in the elevator were telling me how gorgeous of a color my tan was, (I am serious and I am 60 yrs old!) and I told them my legs looked so white when I got there in my summer dresses I went and got one right away! (I forgot to pack mine at home) Love this product and so does my dermatologist who wants me out of the sun and tanning beds for good health!

This is my holy grail, BUT it definitely doesn't have the staying power it used to. I use this once a week in the winter and twice in the summer. The color isn't as dark. Not sure what's different, but I'm definitely having to apply it twice a week to achieve a glow. I don't understand what's going on!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have pale skin & this is great! No issues with application, as long as you have a mitt. It is a nice, gradual, buildable colour. The smell is almost non-existant too! I mix body lotion with a small pump of mousse for hands & feet, as well as face lotion & small pump for face. No issues with streaking. So much better than tanning beds! Nice hint of colour.

I tried out the mini one to see how it came out and I have to say I was impressed with how natural the tan looked. I bought the mitt and a bigger bottle  afterwards since it was staining my hands but definitely worth the investment. After application it would last for about 3 -4 days till I reapply.
i'm addicted to harvey's

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am fair skinned and I like the color this self tanner gives me. I usually apply with a mitt in the evening, leave it on overnight, then rinse in the am. After 5-6 days, the color has faded.
The mousse is way to dark for light skinned people. I'm a light shade (2R06) and an hour after I applied it, I looked like leather...

reviews.review_title: High Price but an HG Tan
reviews.review_text: Honestly, I wish I could say I hated this self tanner because it's so expensive, but there really isn't anything I don't like about it. I've tried so many different self tanners from high end to drugstore, from lotions to gels to mousses, and unfortunately for my wallet St. Tropez does it best. After exfoliating, I apply this tanner with the St Tropez mitt (which is super soft and durable btw) in long straight up and down strokes, then in a light circular motion if it needs more blending. You do have to work quickly because it dries fairly fast, but I like that in a tanner because I hate to feel tacky for an extended period of time while it dries - this one only takes about 5 mins. This tanner is never streaky on me, has a really clean scent (sometimes reminds me of diaper cream with more perfume but it's still nice), never orange and honestly has minimal DHA smell after it's fully developed. It doesn't transfer to my clothes or sheets at all which is huge. I apply it at night and sleep in it to develop and rinse off by morning, and I always wake up to a perfect and very natural golden glow. If I want it even darker I just apply a second coat the next day, but honestly as someone who loves a deep dark tan I rarely feel the need to do this because it looks so beautiful with just the one coat. It lasts a whole week and then some if I'm good about moisturizing every day, and comes off nicely with my exfoliating pad when it's time to reapply. Overall, I will definitely continue to repurchase even though the price makes me cringe - it's THAT good.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Doesn't stay long, doesn't lay on the skin properly, leaves spots and takes too long to dry out

reviews.review_title: horrible; get a spray tan instead
reviews.review_text: Absolutely awful! Followed the directions to the T & even bought the sephora mit for it. What a waste of money. I could see it streaking on my skin immediately. Circular motions don't make a difference! It'll streak regardless. I had to jump in the shower a few minutes after unnoticed streaking and scrub my skin to death to get the awful self tanner off. Tan towels & spray tan booths are way better!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: One of my favorite self tanners, I always come back to this one. The only downside is the pigmented part that helps to guide application rubs off  on everything. I usually apply at night and sleep in it and rinse off in the morning because of the recommended 8 hour processing time for the color to set. It does rub off on my sheets, however I have never had it stain, and it gives me incentive to wash my sheets lol!

This is a fantastic at home tanning mouse! Do yourself a favor and get the hand mitt... and do you skin a favor and get this self tanner! It has a color guide which is perfect for beginners or just for seeing where you have applied the product. The hand mitt is reusable however, do not wash under warm water as it will melt the plastic coating on the inside of the mitt. The color this tanner provides is beautiful and natural. This is a great alternative to tanning. I also use the St. Tropez gradual tan daily moisturizer for upkeep.
This is the best self tan! It is instant color and lasts a long time.

I have been using this for years mostly on my face...too expensive to put all over body unless it is a special occasion.  I use it every day over my moisturizer just to give me a little bit of colour and I love it.  They have repackaged it and I noticed it has a nicer smell which is an improvement and no smell while it is processing. I have olivey tones to my skin so this colour is perfect but I don't think it would suit someone with more of a pinkish tone.
I got a deluxe sample of this AGES ago. I'm just about finished. I actually only use it on my face, mixing it in with my nightly face oil or cream. It gives me a nice subtle glow the next am.

I have been using this mousse for years.  I am very conscious of skin cancer and like to cover my all over freckles as much as possible.  I have tried every self-tanner out there and have had the best results with this one.  Get the mitt - it is worth it.  Another great alternative is disposable rubber gloves that you can get at the drug store.  The trick is to moisturize first - right out of the shower, and then apply the mouse (using the mitt or gloves). The base coat of lotion will keep the mousse from saturating on dry skin.  I have not had any issues with the color being uneven or orange.  It will come off on your sheets and workout clothes but it easily launders out - small price to pay for safe color without parabens.  The improvements to the scent really help mask that weird self-tanner smell you get from other brands.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently used this because I was getting married and didn't want to be pale. I was so impressed by it! It added great color without it looking fake. It truly looked like I had just been out in the sun. Just make sure you exfoliate! That really made a difference...I tried skipping this step once and it went on streaky. Also, make sure you use the glove. I had a little bit of trouble with it blending around the wrist and ankle but it was nothing major, I will just be more careful next time.

This product used to be my hg and would give me a gorgeous natural looking tan for about 4 days. People would always ask me where I'd been on vacation. I put it on at night and shower it off in the morning. Now the tan almost completely disappears after that morning shower and by the next day I am pale as a ghost again. Not happy. Now back to searching for the perfect tanner.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am beyond pale and do not and cannot tan.  I have used many self tanners over the years and this is hands down the best one I have used.  It goes on even with the mitt, the smell is not bad and the color looks natural, not orange.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm pretty fair skinned and this tanner was waaaaay too dark for me. I used the applicator mitt and have used many self-tanners in the past, but it did end up streaky and fake-looking because it was so super-dark. It's definitely long-lasting because it took me a few showers and exfoliating to get rid of it. Just be careful with this if you're fair skinned.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is the best self tanner I've ever used. Goes on easily, dries fast, no smell, lasts a long time, and it's easy to build on the color.  Bonus points for the fact that I am very very fair skinned and I did not look like an orange idiot. Just soft and glowing.

Very user friendly, authentic looking tan. Best for me when I use the application mit. No harsh odor. No streaking. I haven't had any problem with uneven color.  It can be used all over face and body. I highly recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've used this for several years now - reliable in terms of application, ease of use, and color. The color looks natural not fake. I use this on my fair skin and it looks great, or, if I want it deeper, use this after a round of the ST Express tan.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is pretty good stuff. Beautiful color. Goes on smooth and dries fast. Gives you a nice tan glow pretty fast. Does get streaky around ankles and knees so smooth very well there.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Let's get the negative out of the way. This bottle leaks every where and I have to keep it in a sandwich bag. The 4 oz is way to big and I need a larger sandwich bag and have to buy the entire kit for $25 just to get the 1.69 oz Self Tan Classic Bronzing Mousse and put this in a smaller sandwich. - That out of the way. This is a very natural tanner and last, some what after you shower or wash your hands. I do not use the applicator mitt, I use latex gloves and have used latex gloves for years. ( Any doctor visit and these are free) Any areas that I need to remove for excess can be removed with a baby wipe, yes this is the miracle remover. I also use a paint brush, yes a paint brush from an arts store with an angle to apply to areas that need to be evened out after a shower or targeted areas. There is a slight smell but not a self tanner smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my first time writing a review because I feel so strongly about this product! One thing that I don't think is emphasized enough is that St. Tropez came out with this Classic line in response to customers complaining of the DHA smell that sticks with you whenever you applied the normal (old, non classic) formula. They didn't want to reformulate the product (because St. Tropez is one of great ones!), so to address it, they added a complementary scent rather than removing the almighty DHA. IT WORKED! I loved my old mousse but was considering other brands due to the smell, I couldn't take it anymore, and then came the Classic! In some moments I can still detect the plain DHA but the new scent absolutely makes up for it the other 90% of the time. That being said, I still think you should wash it off because that nice new smell doesn't last as long as the DHA -I recommend showering/exfoliating early/mid evening, applying it, going to bed a few hours later and taking another rinse in the morning to not affect the tan. And of course use a mitt and be careful on the joints, enjoy!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have used every tanner our there (including Loving Tan and the new Tarte one) and this beats all (in price and quality). This new formula is so much better. My husband HATES the smell of tanner and this new formula he doesn't mind (as much lol). It's great LOVE LOVE LOVE.
I had never tan myself, but an emergency occurred before my cousin wedding and I was recommended to try to self tan, not bad but it was perfect neither. I didn't enjoy the smell.
This product is great because it covers well and stays on for several days.
This is one of the best self tanners I've used! Looks natural and is easy to apply. Will definitely repurchase
Love this product. Easy to apply. Even tone and very natural looking tan. The best sunless tanner out there. I've tried several tanners and I always come back to this one!!!!!!!! My favorite!!!!!!
This is still the best self tanner I've used. I try others but always come back to it. Great color. Only complaint is the smell but they all have it.

I read tons of reviews before purchasing this product, some great and some awful. I've tried literally hundreds of tanning methods for my very pale skin and was never satisfied. If you follow EVERY instruction included with St. Tropez, you will get a flawless tan. Exfoliate, apply with the mit, don't miss any parts, run it gently over hands and feet, wait to dress until dry, leave it on (I leave it overnight) and SHOWER IT OFF for a perfect, natural looking tan. Rinsing the product off will reveal an even tan whereas if you do not shower, you will be streaky and patchy. It also takes care of that self-tan smell. If your tan is too subtle, you can repeat the process the following day. The tan fades evenly, doesn't look sloppy around hands and feet, and doesn't build up on elbows and knees. Its a bit expensive but worth it for a tan that actually looks believable!
Best self tanner. I am fair to light skin and this tanner provides a perfect color using the mitt. If you are unsure how to apply so it does not streak, watch YouTube for application tips.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I heard so many good things about this and I'm so disappointed to say that this was SO streaky and made me so orange. I used the St. Tropez face mitt and body mitt to apply this and no matter even if I used the smallest amount and rubbed it in real well, it would look great- then the next day STREAKS EVERYWHERE. Even after exfoliation and everything! So frustrating.
I've tried many self tanners at all price points. This color is very natural and fades evenly. I apply it with a mitt. Follow the instructions and you will have amazing results!

reviews.review_title: Best self tanner on the market
reviews.review_text: LOVE this product!!!      Goes on great, dries quickly, no self tanner smell - best of all is the color!!!    I have medium to tan olive skin and many self tanners turn me orange - not this one!!!    I just have a lovely glow.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I can't compare this product to others because this is one of the first self tanners I have used. I must say this tanner is a game changer. The tan has lasted 4 days so far and looks natural. It has faded evenly.I have been hesitant to use self tanners in fear of looking orange. This product is amazing, make sure to purchase a mitt as well. It will make your tan look flawless and cut the application time in half.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product delivers natural, easily blended product. The trick with this product is you must mix it with lotion.   I get the best results by using their St. Tropez mitt. I do 1 pump of non-scented lotion (Aveeno) per 2 pumps of St. Tropez. Then, is squeeze the mitt to lightly blend the products, and then the application is flawless. If you use just the product, it soaks into your skin too fast--so fast that you cannot blend it well.   Lotion helps you continually spread and blend the product together. I bet the majority of the lower reviews are due to misuse of this product. I use it often and it's excellent.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was SO excited to try this product as I have heard so many good comments about it, people were saying this was the best self tanner ever. Well, I am so disappointed. I think I look SO orange with it, and I am naturally tanned so I thought this would have make just a little difference after each application but it looks like I have applied so much. The smell is quite strong, so thats why I put it before I go to bed. I woke up this morning and for the second  time I had strikes on my arms even if I was SO careful with the glove.. And I just feel orange, not natural at all. I would not buy this again!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've never really been one for fake tanning until I found this product. I don't know how they do it by my ghostly fair skin always looks like I've spent a weekend at the beach after using this product. It's so easy to apply, especially with the mit and don't have that super strong self tanner smell. I use this all the time!

I am very fair and have tried many self tanners in my day. This is one of the best ones I've tried.  The color is more natural than many.  I would definitely recommend using the mitt with it.  I think it takes some practice to get it even but the results are good.
I always use self tanning lotions, and this one gives the best  natural tanning.Its super easy to use as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Love this bronzer.  Goes on light. Just remember not to get area wet for several hours, it will streak

I've tried this tanner about two times and it's pretty good. It's not my favorite but I like it. I bought because I was out of my tanner that had to be special ordered and was in desperate need of a tan for the next day so I went to the store and bought this. I just don't think it's dark enough. Wish I would've bought the darker color. But if you are very fair skin, I think you would love it! It does have a green color guide but don't be afraid of that! It washes off the next day! And don't be afraid to scrub your body with a loofa. It didn't make my tan look streaky. I have the full size bottle so I plan to use it up! If your a light medium skin tone, I would go for the darker version.

I have tried so many tanning products. I am super picky about if it is orange or streaky. This is my fourth bottle I have purchased over the past few years. This one is my favorite tanner. It looks natural. Not fake. Not streaky. It looks beautiful on.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This stuff used to be amazing for pale skin. Now it leaves a streaky, awful finish that comes off in patches throughout the night. Also yes, it does still smell like fake tan!!

Ive always loved this tanning mousse and the natural results i got. I purchased this new formula several months ago as a backup to the old one i was using not thinking the change would affect me. Wrong! Ok..so i have very fair asian skin and the old formula left me golden and it was very subtle. I just started this new bottle and noticed the smell and consistency was different. Its not a bad smell, in fact, its a touch better than the old one. The results are now more orange than bronze and very unnatural. Not sure why st tropez would change a good thing.  Hate this new formula and kinda upset because its too late to return.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really like the color! It comes out looking mossy green at first, but once it dries (I put it on a few hours before bed- beware of white sheets!! But will wash out) and then in the morning it looks great. I have very very fair skin, so it does not look orange. I used to use the Jergen's Instant Sun mousse, but I am willing to pay the extra $ for the more natural-looking color. 4 starts because you need to apply about every other day to keep the color going, and hard to rub in, you have to even it out FAST. I definitely suggest using some type of applicator mitt and not your hands. Purchased the travel size or got through points system (can't remember which), but purchased the full size after the small ran out. The small lasted about 3 applications, so I'm thinking the full size should be about 4 times as many applications. I don't use it for my face, as I can break out easily. I use the Tarte Brazilliance wipes for face, which are amazing.

reviews.review_title: love it but not the price
reviews.review_text: I would give this product 5 stars but I can't get past the price! However, it works wonderfully so I guess you get what you pay for. I have very fair skin (I never go in the sun without sunscreen) and this product made me look beautifully tanned with zero streaking and NO orange colors like other tanners! Immediately after applying it, my legs looked perfectly tanned. I love how the mitt keeps your hands clean and keeps it from streaking. I love this stuff!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have never been one to use self tanners because they are usually streaky and smell bad or leave me looking orange. It has been years since I have tried one but I am so glad I stumbled onto this one. It's pretty easy to apply (with the mit) and after using it about 5x I can say I absolutely love the color. It's easy to control how much you put on since it is tinted and it dries pretty fast. I like to walk around naked anyways after I shower so I apply regular body lotion wait 5min and then apply this and hang out for about 10-20 minutes just to make sure it dries really well.  Make sure whatever you put on right after isn't white though since this will rub off a little. It also wears of fast after a work out. I run a lot and where I sweat a lot it wears more but in an even way that doesn't look funky (no one but yourself would notice). Also have received many compliments on how tan I look, and that is impressive since I'm crazy pale and do not tan.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have to say I was so skeptical trying out this new formula. St. Tropez has been my number 1 self tanner for years and nothing else compares. Although I have to admit, this new formula is pretty much just as good as the previous. The scent is a little different, not as dirty smelling but more clean if that makes sense. As far as the color, it is not streaky at all and still has the same green tint it did before. However, I will say it is slightly more orangey than the previous formula but hardly noticeable. Nothing to ever prevent me from using it. Definitely give it a try if you're worried about the new formula! You won't be disappointed.

This is the best self tanner that I have used. I applied 2x in 24 hours and the color was perfect, not orange at all! It does have a mild self tanning lotion scent but not too bad. I will be canceling my tanning bed membership. Super easy to apply, instant color and fast drying

This stuff smells better than anything else i've ever used and doesn't rub off on even a white dress once dried. The only reason i gave it four stars is because it doesn't seem to last more than like for days. Still worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this mousse! I never tried the old formula the other reviewers mention, but I can't imagine it was better than this one. I definitely recommend using the mitt, and it's super easy to apply with that. Goes on smooth, no streaks, and dries fast. It does feel a little sticky, but that goes away after an hour or so. I usually apply at night, and have perfect color when I wake up! I teach fitness classes, and I sweat a LOT, and shave my legs every other day--this tan stays on 5-7 days for me. I do moisturize daily and make sure I don't use any products containing mineral oil or petrolatum-- that will break up the tan.

My review was here yesterday and gone today. Hmmm...  Beware of the formula change. It's awful. I applied this product twice a week for the last 4 years. Purchased a new bottle 2 weeks ago and it's not the same. Took it back. I am trying the new Tarte one. Hope it's a new holy grail.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this product! It is my tried and true! It creates a wonderful natural looking tan! Be sure to shave, exfoliate, and moisturize before applying. Note that when the tan fades, before reapplying, exfoliate the old tan off with a wet wash cloth so you will have a new EVEN tan. I had to learn that the hard way. Happy tanning!

I have been using the St Tropez mousse now for a couple months. I have light skin golden undertones. The color it gives my skin is a nice olive glow that looks good if I don't layer on too much. The smell is tolerable. I exfoliate before applying. It is very drying. I use a pump of lotion on the mitt and mix it with a pump of the tanning mousse it helps keep my skin hydrated. It does go on nicely doesn't streak. I pay attention to making sure it is blended in nicely. It is sticky after applied. It takes several hours for the tan to develop. It lasts maybe 3 days if you don't exfoliate or shave too much. Need to moisturize twice a day to stop skin from getting scales.  It does rub off onto my clothes and sheets which is bad because I like to wear white in the summer time. It doesn't stain though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is hands down the best bronzer on the market.  I have tried them all and this is the best.  It is darker than most but if you blend it really well with a lotion, you can get a lighter color.  The color will also last a week.

reviews.review_title: St Tropez Classic Tan Bronzing Mousse
reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: The formula has changed. This used to me my most favorite and the only self-tan procurement I used.  Starting this year the formula definitely has an orange color to it.  I did purchase a second bottle just to confirm I didn't get a bad bottle.  I will not be purchasing again.

I have tried soooooo many self tanners and this is BY FAR my fave!!! It's so easy to apply (make sure you have the mitt) and smells so good while you're applying it.  The smell does change throughout the day as your ten develops but is not bad at all.  I would like for it to last just a few days longer (on average I think it sticks around and looks good for about 5 days) but other than it's my go to!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am a die-hard St Tropez (Classic, not dark) Self Tan Bronzing Mousse fan. Or, at least I was. The new formula smells disgusting, the color comes out streakier and is much more orange looking than the olivey color I used to get from it. I cannot believe they changed the formula this much.... if something isn't broken, why fix it?! So upset and now will need to find my new HG self-tanner. If anyone has any suggestions for replacements, please let me know. I use self-tanners almost daily in the summer!!! I can't stand this smell for another minute... :(

I have fair skin and I was sceptical about the results... But 8 hours after the application (with the St-Tropez Mitt), I have to admit that the color is pretty !! It's like a tan after a week in Mexico :) The negative side : the smell of the product on my skin... It's almost like a bad drugstore selftanner... Apply at night... But whatever, you'll need a shower in the next 8 hours...

I really like this self tanner and I've suggested it to friends. I'm at an age (33) where sitting in the sun to tan isn't worth the aging effects or the time, especially when working 9-5 M-F consumes most of the summer sun. This tanner gives me summer confidence without harming my skin. It's easy to apply when you use a mitt and I never feel I look orange or streaky. I apply it right after I shower and moisturize. I wish someone invented a contraption to make putting self tanner on one's back easier because that would be super handy for someone living alone w/o extra hands to help! :) Also, I feel the self tanner smell is minimal.

Best self tanner. I'm super pale and this gives a very nice glow... You cannot tell it's a fake tan. The applicator mitt really helps blend the product easily. I would reccomend exfoliating with a scrub, shaving, then moisturizing lightly once dry out of the shower. I use a couple pumps for my legs, blend fast. Then use a damp cloth to wipe knees, wrists, ankles etc. great stuff!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: What a horror ! I specifically was on a hunt for a self-tanner than would not give me an orange streaky result, and this product gives you just that !  While the application process is a dream, you can see where you're applying the mouse to with the instant color results. The fully developed color is an all out orange color. The girl who works at my local Sephora tried to convince me that the green tones in this specific tanner is what prevents the orange tones. Really bummed out because of how easy application is and there is now foul self-tanner smell.

I never felt comfortable in shorts or short dresses because of my extremely pale legs. I recently used this for the first time and I am obsessed. I regret not using this sooner. Don't forget to follow the important steps before self-tanning (shower, shave, & exfoliate). Once you're out of the shower, make sure to moisturize your dry areas (knees, elbows, hands, feet/ankles).   After 15 minutes of applying, I noticed a drastic change in color. 4-8 hours later, I had the perfect tan. Even my husband was surprised. Finally felt confident wearing shorts in public. Love this stuff!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I've never used a self tanner prior to this out of fear my very fair skin would turn orangey.   This doesn't make my skin orange, at all. I bought the mit (honestly, I don't know how people get around using it...it made the application super easy) to use along with it. Showered, exfoliated really well, put a very basic moisturizer on my hands, feet, knees, and elbows. I let myself dry for about 10 minutes, then put on long sleeved shirt and pants (cotton), and slept on white sheets. Woke up this morning to NO staining on my sheets (yay!), took a shower, was complimented on my skin by my boyfriend (double yay!), and then got ready. As a fair skinned girl, this makes me look like I have normal skin color haha, but not like I've been at the beach all day and night. I just look healthy. Nothing looks streaky (apply in a circular motion) and nothing looks darker where it shouldn't.
Great color, easy to apply looks natural. I got a little blotchy in my elbow but that's because I put way too much on. When I applied it correctly it was perfect.
awesome color, not orange at all. not streaky, long lasting, gorgeous! also no strong tanner smell. would always recommend this brand.

Use this with the mitt for faster more blended results. Drys quicks. I have the palest of palest skin out there, i burn easily, and this doesn't make me look orange. Every other lotion out there made me look like an Oompa Loompa and was so streaky and this doesn't do that. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it fades in about 2-3 days before reapplying.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this self tanner. Easy to apply (with the mitt), has a pleasant scent, and does not look orange at all. It goes on looking olive greenish/brown, but quickly turns into a natural looking tan. I will definitely be purchasing this again!

Believe the reviews this is the best! Very blendable, make sure you use the mitt, the smell isn't bad, and your skin wont be orange at all.  Do your research before going into Sephora b/c they won't help too much.  I felt rushed so I found this product myself.  Two things I learned: when washing your hands & mitt make sure you don't splash water on youraelf b/c the color will run.  Also if you need to go out after applying try to wear shorts.  I put on capris & could see the outline after I took them off. Very worth the price.
Looks natural on my skin(I'm a 3y08 olive completion) you have to use a mitt for optimal results. Exfoliate before using to avoid dark patches (give your knees and elbows a good scrub down)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I didn't think any product could take me away from Bare Minerals self tanner until I tried a sample of this. It doesn't stink, it dries quickly, and the color is perfection!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've used St. Tropez for at least 3-4 years and purchased the newly formulated versions of the Classic Bronzing Mousse and the Classic Spray/Mist.  Takes on the new formula -  + New scent is STRONG, but does mask the DHA odor during application/before showering; Still *slightly* smell DHA after shower + Application still good; Lasts about a week for me + Color doesn't have the olive/green base we know and love; Still natural and not orange + BeautyPedia notes that the amount of fragrance and other ingredients in this formula can inhibit collagen production and skin repair. Thought that was kind of alarming and didn't see it for any other brand on Sephora.
OBSESSED . Gives such a natural looking tan, not orange at all... Definitely will repurchase

I'm extremely pale and this is my holy grail self tanner. I've tried so many and this is by far the best and does not make me look orange at all. it stays for about a week on me when usually I get 3-4 days out of other tanners. the only issue I had with this is it made my hair follicles stand out when I applied this after I shaved my legs but it was easily fixed by waiting a day after shaving and exfoliation.
I've used many self tanners and this one by far blows the rest out of the water. I used the mit and I couldn't believe the color and ease! I am not orange and I don't smell.

So glad that I tried the sample before buying full size. It's a nice idea having a dark color so you can see where it's being applied, but it dries fast, very sticky, and even after exfoliating, shaving, and exfoliating again, it turned every hair follicle almost black. So, on top of having orange skin (!), it's also dotted with black marks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was so excited to finally purchase this.  Unfortunately, it just did not work with my skin.  It was more on the orange side--but I could deal with that.  What I can't deal with is the awful patchiness I experience after just one day post-application.  Additionally no matter how well I exfoliate, the tanner just does not stick to certain parts of my body.  I can see these spots while I am applying, but no matter how many times I reapply, it just does not stick.

reviews.review_title: BEST SELF-TANNING PRODUCT YOU'LL EVER USE!
reviews.review_text: Spend as much as you want, try as many as you like, there's NO other product that compares! I'm naturally very pale (typically the 2nd to lightest color in foundation), and even still gives the most believable tan. I've even used this stuff in my face and it's the most radiant, the most beautiful glow I've ever seen. It really does give you that radiant, sun-kissed glow you would naturally get from being in the sun, and the best part no sun damage! Makes you feel like a million bucks!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I use this product and the Dark and I love them both. I use this one when I'm looking for a good glowy color, sometimes I put two layers of this on. The product is so easy to use and to me there is no smell ( I don't mind the smell of self tanners anyways) If you follow the directions you should have no issue. I would also recommending shaving the night before. I don't use this on my face but instead I use the clinique self sun tinted moisturizer and its the best for using on your face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I don't understand how people find issues with this self tanner. I was very pale when I applied this and it looks so natural on me even after 5 days and even though it's fading, it's not flaking off. Be advised that I exfoliated and shaved before application and moisturized and shaved every day after. The self tanner goes on a dark green tinged color and dries rapidly. Has a slight smell a few hours after application but it goes away after you wash it off. Highly recommended.

this is the first and only self tanner i've ever used, it's so easy to apply (definitely use the mitt though) and goes on so well! not orange at all, and it stays on for about a week. it's not super dark so if you want to be really dark i would apply this one a couple times or buy the darker one they make. either way i LOVE this tanner so much

I received this in my monthly josh bag. This is one of many self tanners I have tried. I have never been so happy! I have very fair skin and never tan. The formula is Amazing. Absolutely no streaks and gives a beautiful golden tan.

Bought this hoping it would have lasting power and stay on longer. This tanner stinks SO BAD. I put it on at night and wake up, smell myself and hop right in the shower. It smells absolutely terrible. And it fades so bad, people actually point out the fact that I'm 2 different colors. Never again.
I just started using this since the update in formulation, and I like the change in fragrance and color.

I've used multiple self tanners and I ALWAYS come back to St. Tropez. This is literally THE best tanner on the market. Gives you amazing color. Lasts for over a week. Definitely buy the mitt to use with it.   Doesn't streak and is so easy to apply!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: not orange at all! such a nice brown tan. i think its uses a green base because when the colour dries on my mitt it eventually turns greenish lol. any way this stuff is amazing! YES expensive but it will last a long time! had the bottle for more than a year. also the tan last a good 5 days.

Got this as a sample and I love it! Little to no odor, goes on smoothly (do a smaller section at a time for those that find it difficult to apply) and a very natural color. I am fair with pink undertones and am so happy to find a tanner with good color and low odor!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product works really well although I had more of a light to medium skin tone and I think I would benefit more from the dark mousse. The product lasts about a week. When it's first applied it might look streaky and sets into pores but once you wash it off after the eight hours or the next morning it is really even and gorgeous.

I am pretty fair (usually towards the darker end of the light range in foundation), neutral undertone, and this is the best bronzer that I've ever tried. Long lasting and the perfect color. So quick to apply, and no streaks at all, which I'm usually not able to accomplish :) I'd gotten the small size as a sample, which lasted several full body and legs-only applications, and have now ordered the full size. The one thing - apply it quickly because it will stain your hands right away!

I was surprised to find so many people are unhappy with the new formula. I have been using St Tropez since 2010 and I think it is much better. It finally works on my legs and the color guard isnt as oompah loompah esque. The smell is no where near as strong as the old formula either and I personally think the color looks more natural.
I love it! I was using loving tan.. But OMG i  was orange and way too dark! This one is just the perfect shade and doesnt go in your pores ... Fade naturally love it!!!!

I don't know why everyone is complaining. I LOVE the new formula. The color guide is so much more natural and it dries so much better (can tan in the morning without feeling insecure all day). And it fades more naturally. I had major trouble with the fading with the last formula and that was my only complaint.

I just died a little inside when I saw this product said new.... This was my all time favorite self tanner. I can't believe they changed it. St. Tropez needs to go back to their previous formula. It looks like I'll be on the search for new self tanning products...
The formula is obviously different! Come on St.Tropez don't mess with a good thing!

I've used this self tanner for several years and have always loved it but this new formula is terrible.  They got it right in trying to make it not smell bad but it looks really bad.  It's very orange and goes on streaky.  I will be returning this and searching for an alternative.  Hopefully St. Tropez does something to fix this because the last formula was amazing.

It's one of the best, if not best, self tanners on the market. However, no self tanner is perfect... and if there is one, please let me know. This will leave you with the infamous smell because they all do. I will say this is not as orangey as others on the market. I find the watery foam to be a little difficult so spread evenly as opposed to a lotion but maybe it's what makes it so great. I've had great success with this appearing natural and being easy to work with, but it's not perfect.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I still have the old version i've been using a long time and ordered this Classic version to try it out. Yes it is less like a mousse and sort of on the watery side. I DO look orange and I have light olive skin. I only used it one time so far and my legs look ridiculously orange..not bronze like the old formula. I'm returning this and looking for a new self tanner. What the heck St. Tropez???

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This tanning mousse is great. I was a little wary since there were a decent amount of complaints about the new formula. If you use the mitt and exfoliate like the directions state, you should have no problem! I am very pale and had a great tan after one use.

reviews.review_title: Good self tanner but not great
reviews.review_text: I heard lots of things about this self tanner and so I thought I'll give it a try. Im Asian and super super pale. All my foundation and concealers are the lightest shade of all shades, I'm not joking. Application was easy! There's this mitt that you have to buy separately for the application though. At first you see the streak of the mitt but don't worry, as long as you blend it all in, it'll be even. The color is a little olive after you apply it but after you wash it off, it's like a light orange tan. Of course the more you use it, it's more orange. I wish it was more natural looking because I was really orange due to my super pale skin. When it starts fading, it's really splotchy. It does not fade evenly! Which I hated!! Super annoying.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: this is the first tanning product I have ever tried, because i've been so afraid of turning orange. (I'm very pale) but I love the color that it turned out! my only problem with it is that if you don't apply it very evenly it can come out a bit streaky, but if you're careful when applying, no problems!

I'm naturally very fair with green eyes and dirty blonde hair, I burn and I'm very cautious in the sun. Unfortunately I've always wanted to be tan but I was afraid to use self tanner. I finally took the plunge and I must say, this gives me the most beautiful deep olive tan - it goes on smoothly, doesn't streak with proper application (exfoliate, moisturize, and the mitt), and it dries super fast. Unlike other reviewers, this tan does not come off me in the shower, on the contrary I get 5 days out of this before reapplication. I highly recommend it and will stick with it!

reviews.review_title: Awesome but it does come off
reviews.review_text: It gives a GREAT color, great odor, easy to apply, but it did come off on my VERY WHITE pillow. I'll try the untinted one to see how it works, but I do recommend this one

I kind of love and hate this. If you can stand like a statue for 24 hours, buy this. As soon as you wash your hands or a speck of any liquid touches you, your tan is messed up. I prefer the gradual tan by st tropez. It's amazing.

This used to be my favorite at home tanner. It went on smoothly, never once had a streak. Now they reformulated the product which I received this week without realizing it was different. And yes, the smell is less noticeable. But the tan itself is HORRIBLE. It's at least a shade or two darker than the previous formula. I have streaks everywhere despite using my ever faithful applicator mit. I was banking on this product for my wedding glow and now I'm a week out I am left scrambling to correct these horrible streaks and figure out how I'm going to have a tan in my dress. It is a shame they changed this product.

I have always gone the cheap route and used Loreal tan wipes, but this mousse is amazing! You can use the tan mitt for your body but my face needs a bronze at least twice a week. For my face I use an old foundation face brush and it works perfectly. Just squirt some mouse on a paper plate and dip your brush in it lightly. The tan is a lot more bronzed, not orange at all. I am a naturally tan person but get pretty pale in the winter.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am an avid self tanner, mainly because it looks better for me and its healthier.  I was going on a cruise and wanted to be bronze before going but could no longer find the Victoria secret self tanner that I recently fell in love with (I believe it is discontinued).  I always have heard of St. Tropez but never wanted to spend the money on it but decided to try it.  Usually when I self tan I never use a mit and just wash my hands after application and then later do my hands using a makeup brush.  HOWEVER that process does not work with this product.  After I applied the product to one leg I realized my hand was VERY dark and the tanner did not come off with regular soap.  After scrubbing my hand with Clorox the tanner came off and I continued with my application using rubber gloves.  Loved how this tanner got me very bronzed and it lasted a good bit, the only con I have is a mit MUST be used when applying!

I receive comments all the time on my tan! This product is amazing! I've used a ton of tanners before - they smell and you feel sticky! Not with this product. I use a thick foundation brush to brush on the tanner. Works even better! I'm never orange and I never have streaks! Love this!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: St Tropez self tan mousse is AH-MAZING!  I LOVE IT.  It doesn't streak if you're really paying attention.  Put lotion on and extra lotion in the elbow/knee/wrist area and you'll have a beautiful tan that keeps getting darker throughout the day!  I have had SO many people act so surprised when I tell them it's fake tanner!  I use this and then use some drugstore tan continuation product (I think it is Loreal or something).  It seems to last about 3 days before you need to do some touch up.    Only bad side of this is it takes a while to dry and if you are in a hurry to put on your nice clothes, then you'll have some tanned clothing.. :(  I've made this mistake!  So make sure you have plenty of time to let it dry and don't wear white until the next day! lol.

I decided to stray from my usual tanner and try this one. I'm glad I only used my points on this instead of my money. Some of the problems with this tanner - it goes on mostly clear, which can easily lead to streaking and uneven application. The color it does turn to looks fairly nice come after a few hours, but as soon as you shower the bronze color washes away to revival something far more orange. I have olive toned skin, and this tanner just looks cheap and fake on me.
I have been using the original mousse the past 2 years, the new formula has no scent but the color just isn't the same and seems to fade more patchy.  I'd take the old smell to keep the old color!

I have been in love with this tanner for years and didn't think it could be any better. And then they fixed the scent. Now that odd tanner smell is gone and replaced with the smell of actual sun tan lotion. My obsession has only grown!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: i love the color that this product gives me, it is not orange at all. you should buy the mitt to get a perfect application. my mom, my grandma, and i all love this

I love this product-I used to use a tanning bed religiously and stopped for health reasons, but still wanted a natural looking tan. This foam isn't streaky and it's so easy to apply with the st. tropez tanning mitt. best part-NOT orangey in color whatsoever! I have pale skin, and this stuff works well!

I'm loving the new formula so far! The smell is so much better and the guide color isn't too dark, so you don't look like an Oompa Loompa while you're waiting for it to process. This is still my fav self tanner, the color is so natural - it gives more of a brownish-golden tint instead of the orangey one most give, which I love!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This product is wonderful! At first I was a little timid because I did not know if I was going to be as dark as I wanted to be. However, it gave me the perfect streak free tan that looked completely natural. This was also great because I have very fair skin so I was worried that I was going to come out looking unnaturally tan. It feels great, the smell is not bothersome, and it is super easy to apply if you have an applicator mitt! I would highly recommend this product to anyone that is looking for the perfect, natural looking tan!
I used this for the first time with mitt, I really like it and it was easy to apply. I'm light but I did get the medium dark . I really love the color it gave me and it looks natural.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have received a sample of this tanner 3 times now, I keep trying to like it but it is so darn streaky. I've tried different ways of applying, watched youtube videos.. but it is awful!!!!

reviews.review_title: Jury's still out on new formula
reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've used St Tropez for years and ordered the 100pt travel size for portability.  First, it is not very foamy vs my full size (old formula).  This might just be the bottle and not the stuff inside.   It was more or less totally liquid, not a mousse at all.   I'm worried about it being streaky, since it was a bit harder to spread, but with the glove (a MUST) it still spread OK.  The smell is REALLY DIFFERENT than the old formula.  Much nicer, actually, so I thought i might've gotten a straight-up bronzer instead of an actual self-tanner since it doesn't have that typical self-tanner smell.  The label is a bit ambiguous about this, so we'll see...  I loved the old formula so much, and I sure hope this works the same.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am So obsessed with this stuff. I have tried MANY self tanners; creams, cloths, sprays, and this is the Best, most natural looking product I have ever used. I use the mitt and it is So easy to apply and looks Flawless. Also, NO SELF TANNER SMELL! I am pretty fair and used the Classic Mousse. Will definitely buy again!

Whenever I use self tan lotions they seem to go on relatively evenly. This is the first time I've tried mousse, and after applying on 3 different occasions using the mitt each time, I always come out streaky. The color on this product is wonderful, I almost always have issues with self tanner turning me orange but this stuff is great. I just wish it didn't streak so badly. I'm still trying to figure out ways to get the mousse more even. Maybe the lotion is better?

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is, by far, the greatest self tanner that I've ever used. The guide color comes out looking fairly natural on me until I wash it off, I know some people who've come out looking green until the tan is developed, though. I normally have a very fair complexion and this leaves me with the most natural looking tan. I would suggest this to anyone who's had iffy luck with self tanners, you won't be disappointed.
This stuff smells nice and applies smoothly, especially with the applicator mitt, but I can't for the life of me get it to show any results on my (very white) legs.

I think this tanning mouse is fabulous! It's thin so it spreads nicely! I like to work in section as with ANY tanning product. It has a super natural looking tan. I have extremely fair skin and it looks great. When I first put it on I was worried it wouldn't look right because it has an olive tone as supposed to an orange tone. My goodness, it looks so much better and much more natural than orange/yellow based ones! I think a little goes a long way. It had a pleasant smell when applied and it didn't go on to smell like a spray tan as time went on. I used a big fluffy foundation brush to apply it, as I do all of my tanning stuff. It looks perfect. My only complaint is that it was quite splotchy on my face. Some times I don't really like to tan my face, especially since I wash and exfoliator it so often and it doesn't stay anyways. But, I thought I'd give this one a try. I actually had to wash it off and use my Tarte tanning face towel. All in all-great product and I will purchase the full size!

I will never use another self-tanner! I love it! I have used this in the past and I actually really enjoy the new formula, there is hardly any scent but you still get the same great olive-toned tan. Love!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My first time using St Tropez and I must say that I love this tanner!  I'm olive skinned and this mousse truly enhances my skin tone.  Does not go orange at all.  A huge plus is that there is no stinky BO smell (which I get from every tanning product).  If you didn't purchase the tanning mitt like myself, be careful to immediately wash your hands with soap after application- they go green otherwise.  Overall, absolutely love the product and will def re-purchase!

I used my points to try this before buying the big bottle and I'm glad I did. The mousse is very dark when applying which is great so you can see where it's going but it drys really fast and makes it harder to spread a large amount to more skin. I have dark spots because of overlapping application but i look orange and streaky. Will not be buying

I got this with my points at the beginning of the month, and applied it Saturday evening (it is Monday morning) and I must say, as a natural redhead who has tried tons of different tanners in my life, this is one of the worst. I am orange, streaky, and my hands look like I've been playing in some red clay mud. And yes, i scrubbed my hands multiple times after applying. The formula goes on pretty dark, which is nice bc you can see it, but it dries too quickly and makes blending a problem, leading to uneveness and streaking. And my hands look so bad, I am embarrassed to go in public. I would have to say this is a fail. I'll stick to my tried and true self tanners and SunFX spray tans from now on. Lesson learned.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This mouse gives me a perfect healthy, fresh glow. I'm only knocking a star off because despite the product description- it has the typical fake tan smell. Takes a good shower or two to get the smell off.

I had never used a tanner but had read great reviews so I obtained a sample through a purchase I made recently and I LOVE the results! Instantly I saw my super pale legs turn into an amazing gold color. It's also not strong with the smell at all. Not sticky and even made my legs glow like I had put tons of lotion. Anyway I will definitely buy the actual size! In love!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my very first time using a self tanner; I used my rewards points to get the large sample bottle. I exfoliated & moisturized 24 hrs prior, and then about 30 minutes before applying the self tanner I specifically moisturized my knees, elbows & feet like the bottle instructs. It was really easy to apply a thin, even layer (I purchased and used the mitt -- highly recommend using it), and I noticed a subtle difference right away. The color gradually grew as the day went on and looked great. The product has a light smell, but honestly I was expecting way worse; it wasn't altogether unpleasant and was gone by the next day. I look so nice and tan! I have fair skin so I feel like looking orange or WAY too dark could have easily happened, but I'm super happy with the results. I applied it Sunday late-morning and it's now Tuesday afternoon and it still looks so great and hasn't faded very much (I've showered once in that time). I would definitely recommend this product! (Just be sure you use the mitt, otherwise I can't imagine what your hands would look like afterwards. Yuck.)

I've always loved St Tropez...it was the best tanning product on the market, it's always given an even, healthy glow without the horrible smell or orange color of a lot self tanners. I recently bought a new bottle of the classic tanning mousse and boy was I shocked when I turned oompa loompa orange and the smell lasted on my skin for about a week. I wrote St Tropez which confirmed they changed their formula....so sad, why change something that was so great?! Needless to say I won't be using St Tropez anymore

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've always been afraid to use sunless tanner(the streaks/orange color/etc) but this stuff is amazing! Looks natural and easy to apply with the mitt. The smell isn't the greatest but it's not as bad as most.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm usually pretty bad at self-tanners and give up on them pretty quickly. This is the BEST I've ever used.  The application was easy to see and rub in. I looked tanner right away, and the color built up throughout the day beautifully and looks totally natural. I'm normally suuuuper pale, so it's easy for self-tanners to go wrong.  No streaking! I did get caught in a rain shower later in the day after applying (about 6 hours later) and there were light spots where the rain hit. I buffed the spots with a towel and it still looks great and even!  There was no smell that I noticed, which is HUGE for me (and my fiance). I'm converted!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just got this in the mail the other day. I still had the old formula, so I put the old one on one arm and the new one on the other. People have been complaining about the smell, but for me they both smell good, and after a while all you smell is the self tanner till you rinse it anyway. The new smell is soapier smelling to me. So no biggie. BUT the awesome part about the new formula is that you can see it's tinted greener, so the color when it dries is even better than before. I have tried to find a better tanner than this one, but nothing compares. This one goes on easily, which is huge, some don't blend well, and lasts just as long as any other brand. And, it comes in a mousse which is all I buy anymore. If you're doing it yourself mousse is the best. It's also a great price for 8 oz. My skin is pretty dry and this doesn't patch up on me.  Hope this helps!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I used my reward points to get a sample of this product and fell in love! I used drugstore sunless tanning lotions for years but they always left me smelling strongly of self tanner and rubbed off on my clothes and bedding. This product doesn't rub off on my clothes or sheets, and while it does still have some of the self tanner smell, it's not nearly as bad as the drugstore products I was using in the past. I didn't use a mitt for applying it, just used my hands and washed them thoroughly afterwards. When applied as directed (exfoliate, put lotion on knees, elbows, feet, and then use the tanning mouse) this stuff is awesome! It goes on easily and there are no streaks. I have incredibly pale skin and one application of this is all I needed to be nicely tanned and not orange at all. It made my skin the same tan color that it would naturally turn if I laid out in the sun. People kept telling me how great I looked! It lasted for 4-5 days on me before I needed to reapply. I am converting to St. Tropez for sure!

It's a good tanning, it just has a badddddd after smell. I keep washing my arms it goes away for a good 10 minutes but then the smell comes back! and the smell is so disturbing and it won't go awayyyyy.

I bought this and it was my 1st time using a self tanner; I figured the color and brand would work best for what I wanted. I was way off! The color of the mousse is dark brown, so I assumed the tan itself would look natural. A few hours passed, and I was left looking like an orange! I've spent hours trying to make the tan fade or wipe off, but it won't budge. If you're into a tanner that stays on forever, still has streaks even with the mit, and leaves you a shade of clementine, then this is a great purchase! Not happy.

I used to waste tons of money on Mystic and Versa spa tans prior to finding this. I bought it on a whim and didn't think I would like it and was surprised I did. The application is easy using the recommended mitt. The product goes on smooth and the color last about a week. It definitely is a natural color. So if your looking to go super dark this isn't for you. However if your wanting a believable glow this product is for you. The best part is when it fades it's natural and doesn't come off patchy. And the smell is very light.

I'm very fair skin, and this tan gives me a healthy glow. It's not very dark, but it makes me look healthier than my pasty pale skin. It applies beautifully and I had really no issue with streaking or patchiness. It lasted me about 6 days before it started fading. However, if you don't take care of it (moisturize and use gentle products on it) it can come off patchy. I'm in the process of taking it off right now and it's not coming off as evenly as I would like. Overall though, great self tanner.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Small amount goes a long way. very easy to put on spreads out nicely no lines esp. if you use the circular motion.  Gives a nice dark tan, does not appear orange applying one coat. So far i've only needed one coat of it. Seems to stay on without washing off the same day . Works really well!

I really like this product. I use it in the spring/ summer because it is a deep tan. Every time I wear this people ask what I was doing outside the day before - it really does appear natural on my skin tone (fair but with warm undertones). It lasts for practically a week and fades very evenly on me. I have gotten professional amazing spray tans before but even those fade unevenly in splotches. That's why I like this one so much more because it's a gradual fading (except my face because I exfoliate often) I would use this with a mit only - it would probably be a messy disaster if you used only your hands. I haven't had any streaks but I'm pretty meticulous when applying. I don't mind the smell and actually kind of like it because it reminds me of summer. I've been more satisfied with the results of this than any other self tanner I've tried

reviews.review_title: it was great! BUT They Changed the Formula!
reviews.review_text: I use this product for years and have been really happy about it. Not anymore. Theychanged the formula and I' very disspointed!! If I knew they would change the formula I would have stock on it. The new smell is unberable, like I'm rubbing perfume in my face- which makes me really headachy. Also before, when dispensing the product, it would come out in a mousse consistency, not enymore. It is very liquid and feels very slimy. Last, but not the east, the color result is not near as good as before. It is a bit orangy and it does not last much. To sum it all up, I'm on the market for a new sef tanning! :(

I am on the fence with this product. Why? Cause it has good and bad points.  Pros: Doesn't take much to cover your whole body (I had a small bottle and only used a quarter of the product), color is a good match and not completely (I'll explain completely in cons) orange. Fairly easy to use if you have the mitt to help. This was my first true full body self tanning application experience and I do truly like the color I got from one application.  I'm a medium olive skin tone for reference.  Cons: It does streak (Not truly the self tanners fault) because some places are hard to reach and it isn't immediate so when you wake the next day you see it but it's not extreme. I truly think the mitt is good and bad at the same time cause the bad is the excess product as you keep applying gets cakey in the process. The pro above I would explain is the streaking is orange but seams to be pretty fix able with a makeup remover wipe to dull them down (which makes me wonder just how long this will last once I shower). Why do your feet streak and look the worst with all self tanners? I've done my legs in the past and feet always look gross and that's the self tan dead giveaway!  I only decided to try this process because I'm going on a trip to Costa Rica and winter left my skin with no glowy tan even though I live in Florida. I did the whole process of exfoliating and lotion before as a prep and used all St. TROPEZ products. All and all I do like the product except for the few minor glitches which to some with a lighter skin tone could have a problem with and that's why I'm truly on the fence about it. I only wrote this after first application and sleeping over night in it so I can't speak for how long it last but with even a small bottle I have enough to last for about 3 more application if it only lasts a few days.  It's worth a try I think if your wanting a nice tan without the sun exposure or for a special event but give your self time to correct any issues before hand. I gave myself an extra day so I can correct any issues. Hope this helps others! In order for it to be completely streak free I think you would need help with applying so for the price spraying would probably be easier. : )

First off, I will say this self tanning mousse is a pretty easy application, but as far as color is concerned, it's heavy on the orange side and metallic. I was not skeptical at all when I first applied it and it is a very dark brown substance. However, when I saw that I looked like tanned leather, I said no.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm obsessed with this product. I have been using for about 5 years now, just to maintain color and it gives me the most beautiful glow and tan. I can moderate how light or dark I want to be simply by putting less or more on my body. I don't use the mitt, I use my hands and scrub them afterwards...I'm not picky. I get tons of compliments when I use this product and it makes me feel instantly 5 lbs slimmer lol. I always exfoliate in the shower, then put on some coconut oil all over, let it absorb and then I rub this all over me. It's perfection. It did make my sister a little orange, so I think it affects different skin tones differently, but I am pale/medium...so, IDK but it is worth a try because if it works for you, it's an instant favorite.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have been shopping at Sephora for years and this is my first time ever writing a review only because I am completely in love with this product! I have very pale skin and have tried self tanners for about 8 years and nothing has worked as amazing as St Tropez! It does not leave you orange or have that nasty self tanner smell like others have. The mousse drys quick and the tan could not look any more natural! I always get compliments when I tan with this product and it surprises people that I did not get the tan done at a salon. I bought the mitt once but it completely ripped on my first use. I use my hands to apply and it still comes out streak free and even. I just make sure to scrub off the mousse VERY well after applying, since they tend to get really dark if I don't do so. I definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a beautiful natural glowing tan
This stuff is amazing! I would say i have bought 6 or 7 bottles. I love how long it stays on you and it so easy to apply with a mit.

I just got this as a sample with my beauty insider points yesterday and I love it! I tried it for the first time today I've had it on for about 4 hours and it's developed to a nice golden color not orange at all. No streaking and svery low self tanner smell. I would highly recommend this for a quick way to get bronze and have the color stay for a week or less, it would probably stay longer if you keep it up every day or every other day.
